description: Born in Wittenberg as second son of Lucas Cranach and his wife Barbara Brengbier.
ca. 1527/1529 - beginning of apprenticeship in his father's workshop together with brother Hans.
First mentioned by name in the accounts of his father's workshop.
Until 1537 - Mentioned in accounts for work in the Torgau castle.
Death of his mother Babara. Marriage to Barbara Brück, daughter of the Saxon chancellor Dr. Gregor Brück, from this marriage four children.

Large-format Hercules paintings for the Dresden Palace. Marriage with Magdalena Schurff, daughter of the professor of medicine Augustin Schurff and niece of Philipp Melanchthon, five children from this marriage.
Stay in Weimar together with family and journeymen due to the plague in Wittenberg.
Epitaph for Duke Johann Friedrich of Saxony and Sibylle of Cleve, Weimar City Church of St. Peter and Paul Office of the chamberlain in Wittenberg
Epitaph for Michael Meyenburg, Nordhausen, St. Blasii.
Epitaph for Prince Joachim of Anhalt, Dessau, St. Johannis and St. Marien. Mayor of Wittenberg (until 1567).
Grumbach's Handel, appointment of Cranach for his widowed sister Barbara for the partial return of her husband's confiscated possessions.
Enrolled at the University of Wittenberg.
Death of Cranach's second wife Magdalena, epitaph for Cranach and his two wives in the town church.
